basics.name: Renee O. Setter
basics.label: PhD Candidate
basics.summary: I am a PhD Candidate in Geography and Environment at the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa. My research interests are broadly on projected climate change impacts. My dissertation focuses on impacts on coral reefs. Other projects have assessed climate change impacts on diseases, rainbows, whales, bogs, and managed retreat.

education.institution: University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI
education.thesistitle: Dissertation: The Underestimation of Projected Effects of Climate Change on Coral Reefs

education.institution: University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI
education.thesistitle: Thesis: Coral Restoration Under Climate Change and Other Human Impacts

experience.company: University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa Institute for Sustainability and Resilience
highlights: Research costs and tradeoffs of managed retreat strategies under projected sea level rise in Hawai‘i

experience.company: University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa - BIOL 403: Field Problems in Marine Biology
highlights: Oversaw geospatial portion of field summer course
Guided students through remote sensing analysis using satellite imagery and geospatial analysis in ArcGIS Pro

experience.company: University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa - GEO 101: The Natural Environment
highlights: Led and facilitated review sessions to clarify course content prior to each exam
Lectured and presented course material for one chapter of course content

experience.company: Bay Islands Reef Restoration - Roatán, Honduras
highlights: Analyzed coral growth rates of Acropora cervicornis and Acropora palmata after collecting raw data from nursery
Created a map of coral outplanting sites for future monitoring purposes
Organized coral outplantings and led coral nursery dive-tours with customers
